intro: Acronia cardiostola, commonly known as the heartleaf acronia, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. Acronia cardiostola is often found in humid, lowland forests and thrives in partial shade. Its ornamental value has made it a popular choice for cultivation in tropical gardens.
